results.title: Challenging years
results.creator_credit: Motion Picture Associates, New South Wales Film Corporation, Stanley Hawes and David E. Barrow
results.brief_description: Shows how some elderly men and women have planned for retirement. Illustrates, with dramatic vignettes, the positive and rewarding aspects of this period of life, and warns of the pitfalls to be avoided.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Motion Picture Associates, New South Wales Film Corporation, Stanley Hawes and David E. Barrow

results.title: Challenges and rebirth
results.creator_credit: Kwang Hwa Mass Communications, Weng Jeng-Yih, Jao Ming and Lin Yung
results.brief_description: Documents the achievements of the Taiwanese people since the establishment of the Republic of China in 1949. The transition was difficult, but through hard work and dedication, Taiwan made its mark on the world marketplace. In the 21st Century, the Taiwanese are dedicated to further developing their “laissez-faire’ economy and democratic reforms.

results.title: Challenger: an industrial romance
results.brief_description: Challenger: An Industrial Romance follows the development of Canadair’s super-executive jet. A totally new type of aircraft, it is faster, cheaper to fly, and more comfortable than any other business jet. Would it make it off the drawing board and into the air? The film captures the spirit of the Canadian air transport industry and its attempt to compete with the American leaders in the industry. (Awards: San Francisco; Elmhurst; Toronto; Columbus; Budapest; New York)

results.title: Challenge: Tasmania
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian State Film Unit, Ray Barnes and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: To all men the sea is a challenge, particularly to the yachtsmen who annually sail in the Sydney to Hobart ocean classic. 1971 was the final in the series for the Southern Cross Cup which was won by the New Zealanders. This film is a gripping account of the race.

results.title: Challenge: science against cancer
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Morten Parker
results.brief_description: How far have scientists advanced toward solving the riddle of cancer, and what are the key problems now facing them? To explain the enormous complexity of the problem, the film traces briefly the growth and multiplication of a single fertilized cell into an adult man, and asks why some outlaw cells begin persistent growth after the whole body has reached maturity. Research scientists are shown following up clues with test tube, microscope, controlled diets and other aids that may guide them to the eventual solution. Methods of treatment being used meanwhile for different types of cancer are briefly described. As each new aspect of the disease is revealed, the secret of cancer is seen to be as complex as the universe itself, and the quest for its solution one of the greatest adventures on which a scientist can embark. Animation by Colin Low and Evelyn Lambart. Voice and narration by Raymond Massey. Awards: New York; Venice

results.title: Challenge to mankind
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Donald Fraser
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
Five world-renowned authorities voice their opinion on the threat to mankind of overpopulation, and tender some possible solutions. Views are expressed by Madam Pandit of India, Paul Hoffman of the United States, Lord Boyd Orr of the United Kingdom, Dr Victor Belaunde of Peru and Dr Hugh Keenleyside of Canada. Animation by Rene Jodoin and Kaj Pindal. Narrated by Stanley Burke.

results.title: Challenge to Lassie
results.brief_description: As a young pup in Scotland, Lassie grows to be an extraordinary sheepdog. Tragedy strikes however, when her beloved master (Donald Crisp) is killed by beggars, leaving Lassie to grieve by his grave. Without an owner, Lassie falls victim to the law as her fate is debated in an Edinburgh court. It is there that her former master’s friend, a tavern proprietor (Edmund Gwenn) comes to Lassie’s rescue, calling upon the court to spare this unusually kind and intelligent dog. Exceedingly popular throughout the years, this, the sixth feature film in the classic series, Lassie’s appeal spans generations of children and adults, making her one of the most beloved animals in motion picture history. Based on the novel “Greyfriars Bobby” by Eleanor Atkinson.

results.title: Challenge over the Atlantic
results.creator_credit: ABC Sports (US) and Vantage Communications Inc.
results.brief_description: In 1979 Ben Abruzzo, Maxie Anderson and Larry Newman flew a hot air balloon, the Double Eagle II, across the Atlantic from U.S.A. to France, succeeding where hundreds of others had failed for over a century. The factors that enabled these three to surmount an enormous challenge and succeed where others failed are the same as those required to achieve superlative goals in any field. Includes interviews with the three men who discuss their philosophies on setting goals, surmounting challenges, teamwork and superior performance.

results.title: Challenge of the trade
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, George Cass and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: Lucianne New follows the career of Dale Baker, principal dancer with the Australian Ballet including footage of Dale performing one of the leading roles in the popular musical “Cats”. Dale shares his thoughts on being male in a world of dance.
